channel.title: When i click run [too long to describe on here, please check the message]
channel.description:
When I click runserver.bat this comes up
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/16jgqu.png[/img]
And just keeps on repeating itself, then when it says "Port already in use" that comes up and any random moment. Any one Know whats going on? thanks for any help :)

item.title: When i click run [too long to describe on here, please check the message]
item.dc:creator: @icp_again icp again
item.description:
@icp_again wrote:

I didn’t add anything, it just happened out of nowhere, to top it off it was late last night (2:00AM) and i forgot what i added, I think Ijust added something weird to the //second click npc in the client.java, I’ll check that

checking

I didn’t find anything possibly wrong…GAH! I’m so pissed, lol.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2009, 02:53:16 pm[/size][hr]SORRY FOR THE DOUBLE POST!

This is going to sound crazy but, I think it has something to do with the CFG files, I had the original source I downloaded, with everything the same as when I downloaded it (blank source) and I tried it and it worked, then I took all of those out, then replaced them with the newer and most updated CFG that i created and then i got the error. So something in the CFG must be the problem right? Or am I just crazy? what do you think?

Read full topic

GET ANOTHER SOURCE[/quote]

It worked before…Now it’s not…and No because the source I’m using is really great.

madgamer:

Are the initialize/shutdown packets on a loop?

That’s possible, where do I find the initialize/shutdown packets?

item.title: When i click run [too long to describe on here, please check the message]
item.dc:creator: @icp_again icp again
item.description:
@icp_again wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:4, topic:269385”]Read what the error actualy says. A chimp, if trained, could recognise what it means.

PORT ALREADY IN USE.

If something is already in use you close the thing using the port and then run your crap server. Rune-escape has crashed my computer but when compiling there are no warnings[/quote]

I don’t think you understand what I mean…That is the only thing running. I even restarted my comp a few times. And had nothing running and tried it, still nothing, so don’t call me dumber than a trained chimp.

Read full topic
